skill.name: receiving-code-review
skill.description: Use when receiving code review feedback, before implementing suggestions, especially if feedback seems unclear or technically questionable - requires technical rigor and verification, not performative agreement or blind implementation
skill.summary: Use when receiving code review feedback, before implementing suggestions, especially if feedback see...
skill.author: Cygnusfear

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Contains only behavioral guidelines for handling code review feedback. No file access, network calls, or command execution capabilities.

content.user_title: Evaluate code review feedback with technical rigor
content.value_statement: Code review feedback often requires verification before implementation. This skill ensures Claude evaluates suggestions technically, asks clarifying questions when needed, and pushes back when feedback is incorrect or unclear.
actual_capabilities: Evaluates code review feedback for technical correctness before implementing
Identifies unclear or technically questionable suggestions requiring clarification
Verifies suggestions against codebase reality and existing functionality
Pushes back on incorrect feedback with technical reasoning
Prevents blind implementation of unchecked suggestions
limitations: Does not modify code or execute changes automatically
Does not access external code review tools or platforms
Does not provide automated code analysis or linting

use_cases.title: Verify review suggestions
use_cases.description: Evaluate external code review feedback before implementation to prevent introducing bugs or regressions

use_cases.title: Maintain code quality
use_cases.description: Ensure code review feedback is technically sound and appropriate for the specific codebase context

use_cases.title: Improve code review process
use_cases.description: Establish consistent standards for evaluating and responding to code review feedback

prompt_templates.title: Evaluate suggestion
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the receiving-code-review skill to evaluate this suggestion: [paste feedback]. Check if it is technically correct, breaks existing functionality, or conflicts with project decisions.

prompt_templates.title: Request clarification
prompt_templates.prompt: I received code review feedback but do not fully understand some items. Use receiving-code-review to help me identify what needs clarification and how to ask effectively.

prompt_templates.title: Push back correctly
prompt_templates.prompt: I believe a code review suggestion is technically incorrect. Use receiving-code-review to help me construct a technical, evidence-based pushback response.

prompt_templates.title: Verify before implementing
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to implement code review feedback but need to verify it first. Use receiving-code-review to guide me through the verification checklist.

output_examples.input: Reviewer suggests removing legacy code and adding proper metrics tracking with database, date filters, and CSV export
output: Suggestion requires YAGNI check - grep codebase for actual usage
Current implementation: endpoint exists but is unused
Recommended response: 'This endpoint has no callers. Remove it (YAGNI)? Or is there usage I'm missing?'
Do not implement database metrics until actual use cases are identified

best_practices: Always verify code review feedback against the actual codebase before implementation
Ask clarifying questions when any item is unclear rather than guessing
Use technical reasoning when pushing back, not defensiveness or apologies
anti_patterns: Performative agreement like 'You're absolutely right!' or 'Great point!'
Blind implementation of suggestions without technical verification
Batch implementing multiple items without testing each one individually

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for evaluating code review feedback.

faq.question: Does this skill execute code changes?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides behavioral guidelines for evaluation only. It does not modify code.

faq.question: How is this different from normal Claude behavior?
faq.answer: Adds systematic verification steps, clarifies when to push back, and avoids performative agreement.

faq.question: What data does this skill access?
faq.answer: No data access. It is a prompt-based skill providing response guidelines only.

faq.question: What if feedback seems correct but I cannot verify it?
faq.answer: State the limitation: 'I cannot verify this without [X]. Should I investigate, ask, or proceed?'

faq.question: How does this compare to a linter or code analyzer?
faq.answer: This skill guides behavioral response to human feedback, not automated code analysis or error checking.
